channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pope Francis thanks medical staff for 'thoughtful' and 'tender' care
item.description: The Vatican said on Saturday the Pope had shown a "good response" in recent days to his treatment at Rome's Gemelli hospital.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn on skiing the comeback trail

item.title: Syria leader calls for peace after hundreds of civilians killed
item.description: More than 700 civilians of the Alawite religious minority have been killed, the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says.

item.title: Gene Hackman died at home a week after wife Betsy Arakawa died from hantavirus, authorities say
A timeline of how actor Gene Hackman and Betsy Arakawa died at their New Mexico home
Secret Service shoot man carrying gun near White House
item.description: A man brandished a firearm near the White House, leading to an "armed confrontation," the Secret Service said in a statement.

item.title: 5 years ago, movie theaters closed. NPR's movie critic looks back at COVID-19

item.title: This synagogue calls itself 'anti-Zionist.' Here's what that means in practice
item.description: Tzedek Chicago calls itself anti-Zionist congregation, meaning it does not support a Jewish nation-state.

item.title: Mass blackouts in storm-hit eastern Australia
item.description: Residents are warned power may not return for days as further heavy rainfall is forecast.

item.title: Iran criticises 'bullying countries' after Trump letter for nuclear talks
item.description: Trump says he offered Iran a chance to negotiate on their nuclear programme or face military action.

item.title: DR Congo offers $5m bounties for rebel leaders
item.description: The M23 rebel group has seized large parts of the mineral-rich eastern DR Congo this year.
